title: Host Environment Trust Manifest (HETM) Schema
description: Mandatory specifications for the underlying computational environment verified at GSEP-C S0 (INIT). Requires CRoT signature.

manifest_id.description: Unique identifier for this specific manifest instance.

required_platform_measurement.description: The cryptographically attested boot/attestation measurement (e.g., PCRs or Hypervisor hash). Must be SHA384 hex (96 characters).

synergy_runtime_configuration_hash.description: SHA256 hash of the AGI-KERNEL runtime state, mandatory coverage includes: kernel version, loaded configuration files, and the canonical set of active Emergent Capabilities (retrieved via ecm.list()). Required for Living Runtime audit trails.

minimal_os_integrity_level.description: Minimum required security certification level of the host environment. Must align with GACR Tier Classification (1-5).

triumvirate_segmentation_rules.description: Defines mandatory isolation constraints for the Sovereign Global Segment (SGS), Global Axiomizer (GAX), and Cryptographic Root of Trust (CRoT).

memory_isolation_policy.description: The required memory protection policy enforced by the hypervisor. Added Hardware_Enforced for clarity on CRoT boundary.

vCPU_pinning_requirement.description: True if agent execution requires dedicated, non-shared physical cores.

audit_log_endpoint.description: Certified and cryptographically bound endpoint for immutable log relay prior to S8 persistence.

attestation_signature.description: CRoT signature verifying the integrity and origin of the HETM manifest payload. Must be 192 hex characters (e.g., ECDSA P-384).
